channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Third IRS head since Trump’s inauguration resigns because she reportedly wasn’t told about an agreement forcing the agency to give taxpayer data to immigration officials
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem signed the agreement on Monday, April 7.

item.title: Jon Hamm Finds His Way Back to the Hilltop
item.description: For the actor, the decade since “Mad Men” ended has been a period of personal change and mixed professional success. Suddenly, he is everywhere again.

item.title: Medicare Bleeds Billions on Pricey Bandages, and Doctors Get a Cut
item.description: Medicare spending on “skin substitutes” made of dried placenta has soared as doctors pocket lucrative discounts from sellers.

item.title: Search Ends for Victims in Dominican Republic Roof Collapse That Killed 221
item.description: The collapse of the roof at Jet Set, one of Santo Domingo’s most popular nightclubs, killed many prominent Dominicans, including baseball players and ...

item.title: Apple’s Steve Jobs dealt with the 2008 financial crisis not by layoffs or slimming spending but by investing his way through the downturn—and it paid off
item.description: Just two years after the 2008 financial crisis, Apple released the iPad.

item.title: He’s just Ken: LeBron James becomes first pro male athlete Barbie doll as Mattel bets on adult customers
item.description: Mattel’s release of a LeBron James Ken doll solidifies its stance in growing its adult consumer base.

item.title: Elon Musk accused of rage quitting while live-streaming a video game after repeatedly dying and being mercilessly cyberbullied by viewers
item.description: The world's most influential entrepreneur was mercilessly jeered at by an online gaming audience still angry that he had so casually lied about cheati...

item.title: What Trump’s Tariffs Mean for Global Economy, and You
item.description: The newest wave of President Trump’s trade policies increased global uncertainty, causing stocks to fluctuate significantly.

item.title: ‘They’re Coming After All of Us. So You Might As Well Tell the Truth.’
item.description: The longtime activist and writer Sarah Schulman on why now is the time to stand up to people you oppose.

item.title: ‘Bond King’ Bill Gross warns Gen Z and millennials will be the biggest losers from tariff-fueled market swings that rely on whether Trump ‘had a good night’s sleep’
item.description: The president pressed pause on some tariffs, but after a relief-fueled rally, stocks retreated less than 24 hours later and fears of inflation and a p...
